meanings.definition: A portable stereo system with built-in speakers.
meanings.sent1: I carried my boombox to the park to listen to music.
meanings.sent2: She turned on the boombox to play her favorite songs.
meanings.sent3: The boombox started dancing when the music played.
meanings.sent4: The boombox's voice filled the room with melodies.
meanings.sent5: The colorful boombox was as loud as a lion's roar.

meanings.definition: To play music loudly from a boombox.
meanings.sent1: He would boombox his favorite tunes on the street.
meanings.sent2: They decided to boombox some old classics at the party.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors complained when he would boombox late at night.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter boomboxed through the room, infectious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The music boomboxed through the air, making everyone dance.

meanings.definition: The boombox was popular in the 1980s.
meanings.sent1: In the 1980s, everyone wanted a boombox to carry around.
meanings.sent2: The boombox symbolized the music culture of that era.
meanings.sent3: The boombox from the 1980s looked like a colorful robot.
meanings.sent4: His boombox from the 1980s was a time machine to his youth.
meanings.sent5: The 1980s boombox was a fashion statement, carried proudly by many.
